properties.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 14 at 7:36PM CST until January 14 at 10:30PM CST by NWS Jackson MS
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Jackson has issued a

* Flash Flood Warning for...
Southeastern Covington County in southeastern Mississippi...
Jones County in southeastern Mississippi...

* Until 1030 PM CST.

* At 735 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing
heavy rain across the warned area. Up to two inches of rain have
already fallen and this will fall on saturated soils that recieved
2 to 3 inches in the last 24 hours. Flash flooding is ongoing or
expected to begin shortly.

HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms.

SOURCE...Radar indicated.

IMPACT...Flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas,
highways, streets and underpasses as well as other
drainage and low lying areas.

* Some locations that will experience flooding include...
Laurel, Ellisville, Collins, Sandersville, Mill Creek, Sanford,
Tuckers Crossing, Moselle and Seminary.
properties.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood
deaths occur in vehicles.

Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the
dangers of flooding.

CMAMtext: NWS: FLASH FLOOD WARNING this area til 10:30 PM CST. Avoid flooded areas.
